contextId.information: "he will go to where his fathers' generation is." This is a euphemism that means that the rich man will die and join his ancestors in the grave. AT: "he will join his ancestors in the grave" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: he will go to the generation of his fathers

contextId.information: "killed them while they were still young" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
This is a polite way of speaking about someone killing someone else. AT: "They have almost killed me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: They have almost made an end to me on earth

contextId.information: This is a polite way to refer to someone dying. AT: When a person dies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: When a person's life's breath stops
